body.p:
Burlington Boone Co Ky
Sept 11. 1865,
Gov: Thos E. Bramlette.
Dear Sir:
One John Sanders at the Special May Term 1863 of this court was indicted by the Grand Jury of this county for shooting one Joshua Ellis. -- said Indict. is for "murder" --

John Sanders is at large -- and as I understand is in the state of Indiana. The Shff of Switzerland Co in that state wrote me a few days ago inquiring about the Reward for his apprehension. stating that if the Reward was good and certain, that he would have the said Sanders forthcoming. I lay the matter before you, leaving you to act as you see proper.

Your Servt.
A G Winston
Clk Boon Circt Ct --

Burlington Boone Co Ky
To his Excellency thos E Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky Sir

Information having come to me, leading me to beleive that One John Sanders who was indicted at the Boone Circuit Court in May 1863, for the murder of Joshua Ellis is now at large in the State of Indiana (having never been tried) I ask your Ex to offer a reward for the apprehension of the said John Sanders that he may be propperly brought to trial in this county according to law the official charge having been committed in this co

Robt F" Coleman
Pres juedg Boone Cnty Court

Burlington, Boone Co. Ky, Sept. 18. 65.
Dear Governor:

I hope you will issue a proclamation offering a reward for the arrest of John Saunders. The murder was unprovoked & diabolical -- & the murderer is now at large in Indiana. Please prepare the papers & direct them to me at Warsaw, where I shall probably remain 2 weeks.

Your friend,
John L. Scott
Com. Atty

Reward
Boone Cir Ct
vs
John Sanders
$200. offered 20th Sept/65
